Have you had toasted cheese?  It is way better!  Try this experiment:  eat 1 piece of plain white bread with a single piece of American cheese on it.  Meh, right? Harder, unmelted cheese has a chalky or gummy mouthfeel, which I find unpleasant, but it is more about the taste. Take the same cheese and get three pieces. Leave one alone, melt one, and make a cheese frico with the third. They are going to progressively taste better, even if you let the melted cheese cool down, because the proteins and fats are reorganizing so you have easier access to the aromas and the texture isn't that gummy, chalky feel of wet cheese(the main reason I hate cheese on salads). Also, the frico has had the cheese flavor condensed and you also have the Mallard reaction with the sugars in the cheese to change the flavor.
